'''''Mythlore'' 33''' ([https://dc.swosu.edu/mythlore/vol9/iss3/ Volume 9, Issue 3]) is an issue of the ''[[Mythlore]]'' journal, published by the [[Mythopoeic Society]].
==Contents==

====Articles====

* Hennelly, Mark M., Jr. “The Road and the Ring: Solid Geometry in Tolkien's Middle-earth.”
* DeJaynes, Randy L. “The Making of Things Other Than the Self: Revelation and Creation in Descent Into Hell.”
* Logan, Darlene. “Battle Strategy in Perelandra: Beowulf Revisited.”
* Kawano, Roland M. “C.S. Lewis: The Public Poet.”
* Christopher, Joe R. “Lewis Carroll, scientifictionist.”
* Berman, Ruth. “White Knight and Leech Gatherer: the Poet as Boor.”

====Poetry====

* Anonymous Dancer. “Chorea Magna.”
* Schwindt, John. “Khazâd-dûm.”

====Features====

* GoodKnight, Glen H. Editorial Notes.
* GoodKnight, Glen H., et al. The 15th Anniversary of The Mythopoeic Society.
* Christopher, Joe R. An Inklings' Bibliography (22).
* Hyde, Paul Nolan. “Quenti Lambardillion: A Column on Middle-earth Linguistics.”
* Ellwood, Gracia Fay. “Matters of Grave Import: A Column.”
* Speth, Lee. “Cavalier Treatment: A Column.”
* Letters.

====Reviews====

* ''Brothers and Friends: The Diaries of Major Warren Hamilton Lewis.'' Edited by Clyde S. Kilby and Marjorie Lamp Mead. Reviewed by Nancy-Lou Patterson.
* ''SEVEN; An Anglo-American Literary Review, Volume 2.'' Dr. Barbara Reynolds, Dr. Clyde S. Kilby, and Dr. Beatrice Batson. Reviewed by Nancy-Lou Patterson.
* ''J.R.R. Tolkien.'' Deborah Webster Rogers and Ivor A. Rogers. Reviewed by Nancy-Lou Patterson.
* ''C.S. Lewis and the Church of Rome.'' Christopher Derrick. Reviewed by Nancy-Lou Patterson.
* ''C.S. Lewis. The Art of Enchantment.'' Donald E. Glover. Reviewed by Nancy-Lou Patterson.
